001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.logging;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.log.LogUi;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.enums.WebElementAction;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.helper.LocatorParser;
006import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
009import java.util.stream.Collectors;
010import org.openqa.selenium.By;
011import org.openqa.selenium.ElementClickInterceptedException;
012import org.openqa.selenium.ElementNotInteractableException;
013import org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException;
014import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
015import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;
016
017/**
018 * Provides logging functions for exception handling during Selenium WebDriver interactions.
019 * This class logs detailed information for various exceptions encountered while performing
020 * actions such as finding elements, clicking, sending keys, and submitting forms.
021 *
022 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
023 */
024public class LoggingFunctions {
025
026   private static final String OUTER_HTML = "outerHTML";
027   private static final String INNER_HTML = "innerHTML";
028   private static final int MAX_LENGTH = 1000;
029   private static final String PAGE_SOURCE_UNAVAILABLE = "Page source unavailable.";
030
031
032   private LoggingFunctions() {
033   }
034
035   /**
036    * Logs a {@link NoSuchElementException} when an element cannot be found from the root level.
037    *
038    * @param target The WebDriver instance.
039    * @param action The WebElement action being performed.
040    * @param args   The method arguments.
041    * @param e      The thrown exception.
042    */
043   public static void logFindElementFromRootNoSuchElementException(final Object target, final WebElementAction action,
044         final Object[] args, final InvocationTargetException e) {
045      By locator = LocatorParser.extractLocator(args);
046      Throwable cause = e.getCause();
047      WebDriver driver = (WebDriver) target;
048      String pageSource = truncateString(driver.getPageSource(), MAX_LENGTH);
049      String additionalInfo = String.format(
050            "Exception [%s]: Failed to locate element using locator [%s] at the root level.%n"
051                  + "Possible reasons: incorrect locator, element not present in the DOM, or slow page loading.%n%n"
052                  + "Current Page Source (truncated):%n%s",
053            cause.getClass().getSimpleName(), locator, pageSource);
054      logException(cause.getClass(), target, action.getMethodName(), args, additionalInfo);
055   }
056
057   /**
058    * Logs a {@link NoSuchElementException} when an element cannot be found from another element.
059    *
060    * @param target The target WebElement.
061    * @param action The WebElement action being performed.
062    * @param args   The method arguments.
063    * @param e      The thrown exception.
064    */
065   public static void logNoSuchElementException(final Object target, final WebElementAction action,
066         final Object[] args, final InvocationTargetException e) {
067      Throwable cause = e.getCause();
068      By locator = LocatorParser.extractLocator(args);
069      WebElement element = target instanceof WebElement we ? we : null;
070      if (element == null) {
071         logException(cause.getClass(), target, action.getMethodName(), args,
072               "Exception [" + cause.getClass().getSimpleName()
073                     + "]: Element is null, possibly due to a stale reference or incorrect locator.");
074         return;
075      }
076      String outerHtml = truncateString(element.getDomAttribute(OUTER_HTML), MAX_LENGTH);
077      String innerHtml = truncateString(element.getDomAttribute(INNER_HTML), MAX_LENGTH);
078      String elementDetails = LocatorParser.getElementDetails(element, outerHtml, innerHtml);
079      String actionMessage = switch (action) {
080         case FIND_ELEMENT, FIND_ELEMENTS -> locator != null
081               ? String.format("Exception [%s]: Unable to locate element [%s] using locator [%s].",
082               cause.getClass().getSimpleName(), element.getTagName(), locator)
083               : String.format("Exception [%s]: Unable to locate element [%s], but no locator was provided.",
084               cause.getClass().getSimpleName(), element.getTagName());
085         case CLICK -> String.format("Exception [%s]: Click action failed on element [%s] with text [%s].",
086               cause.getClass().getSimpleName(), element.getTagName(), element.getText());
087         case SEND_KEYS -> String.format("Exception [%s]: Unable to send keys to element [%s] with text [%s].",
088               cause.getClass().getSimpleName(), element.getTagName(), element.getText());
089         case SUBMIT -> String.format("Exception [%s]: Unable to submit form using element [%s].",
090               cause.getClass().getSimpleName(), element.getTagName());
091         default -> "Unknown action.";
092      };
093      String additionalInfo = actionMessage + "\n" + elementDetails;
094      logException(cause.getClass(), target, action.getMethodName(), args, additionalInfo);
095   }
096
097   /**
098    * Logs an {@link ElementNotInteractableException} when an element cannot be interacted with.
099    *
100    * @param target The target WebElement.
101    * @param action The WebElement action being performed.
102    * @param args   The method arguments.
103    * @param e      The thrown exception.
104    */
105   public static void logElementNotInteractableException(final Object target, final WebElementAction action,
106         final Object[] args, final InvocationTargetException e) {
107      Throwable cause = e.getCause();
108      WebElement element = target instanceof WebElement we ? we : null;
109      if (element == null) {
110         logException(cause.getClass(), target, action.getMethodName(), args,
111               "Element is null, cannot log additional info.");
112         return;
113      }
114      String outerHtml = truncateString(element.getDomAttribute(OUTER_HTML), MAX_LENGTH);
115      String innerHtml = truncateString(element.getDomAttribute(INNER_HTML), MAX_LENGTH);
116      String elementDetails = LocatorParser.getElementDetails(element, outerHtml, innerHtml);
117      String additionalInfo = String.format(
118            "Exception [%s]: Element [%s] with text [%s] is not interactable when attempting to perform %s().%n"
119                  + "Possible reasons: hidden, disabled, overlapped, or detached from the DOM.%n%nElement Details:%n%s",
120            cause.getClass().getSimpleName(), element.getTagName(), element.getText(), action.getMethodName(),
121            elementDetails);
122      logException(cause.getClass(), target, action.getMethodName(), args, additionalInfo);
123   }
124
125   /**
126    * Logs an {@link org.openqa.selenium.InvalidSelectorException} when an invalid selector is used.
127    *
128    * @param target The WebDriver or WebElement instance where the action occurred.
129    * @param action The WebElement action being performed.
130    * @param args   The method arguments, expected to contain a locator.
131    * @param e      The thrown exception.
132    */
133   public static void logClickInvalidSelectorException(final Object target, final WebElementAction action,
134         final Object[] args, final InvocationTargetException e) {
135      By locator = LocatorParser.extractLocator(args);
136      Throwable cause = e.getCause();
137      String additionalInfo = String.format("Invalid selector while clicking element. Malformed locator: [%s].",
138            locator != null ? locator.toString() : "null");
139      logException(cause.getClass(), target, action.getMethodName(), args, additionalInfo);
140   }
141
142   /**
143    * Logs an {@link ElementClickInterceptedException} when an element cannot be clicked.
144    *
145    * @param target The target WebElement.
146    * @param action The WebElement action being performed.
147    * @param args   The method arguments.
148    * @param e      The thrown exception.
149    */
150   public static void logElementClickInterceptedException(final Object target, final WebElementAction action,
151         final Object[] args, final InvocationTargetException e) {
152      Throwable cause = e.getCause();
153      WebElement element = null;
154      if (target instanceof WebElement webElement) {
155         element = webElement;
156      }
157      if (element == null) {
158         logException(cause.getClass(), target, action.getMethodName(), args,
159               "Element is null, cannot log additional info.");
160         return;
161      }
162      String outerHtml = truncateString(element.getDomAttribute(OUTER_HTML), MAX_LENGTH);
163      String innerHtml = truncateString(element.getDomAttribute(INNER_HTML), MAX_LENGTH);
164      String elementDetails = LocatorParser.getElementDetails(element, outerHtml, innerHtml);
165      String blockingLocator = LocatorParser.extractLocatorFromMessage(cause.getMessage());
166      String additionalInfo = String.format(
167            "Failed to %s on element:%n%s%nLocator of the blocking element: [%s]",
168            action.getMethodName(), elementDetails, blockingLocator);
169      logException(cause.getClass(), target, action.getMethodName(), args, additionalInfo);
170   }
171
172   /**
173    * Logs a {@link TimeoutException} when an element is not found within a given time frame.
174    *
175    * @param target The WebDriver or WebElement instance where the action occurred.
176    * @param action The WebElement action being performed.
177    * @param args   The method arguments, expected to contain a locator and an optional timeout duration.
178    * @param e      The thrown exception.
179    */
180   public static void logClickTimeoutException(final Object target, final WebElementAction action,
181         final Object[] args, final InvocationTargetException e) {
182      Throwable cause = e.getCause();
183      By locator = LocatorParser.extractLocator(args);
184      long timeout = 0L;
185      if (args != null && args.length > 1 && args[1] instanceof Long l) {
186         timeout = l;
187      }
188      String timeoutMessage = timeout > 0 ? "Waited for " + timeout + " milliseconds." : "No specific timeout set.";
189      String additionalInfo = String.format(
190            "Timeout while waiting for element to meet condition: [%s]. Locator: [%s]. %s",
191            action.getMethodName(), locator != null ? locator.toString() : "Unknown locator", timeoutMessage);
192      logException(cause.getClass(), target, action.getMethodName(), args, additionalInfo);
193   }
194
195
196   private static void logException(Class<? extends Throwable> throwable, Object target, String methodName,
197         Object[] methodArgs, String additionalInfo) {
198      LogUi.extended("Exception: [{}] thrown on target: [{}({})] from method: [{}] called with argument types: [{}]",
199            throwable.getSimpleName(),
200            target.getClass().getSimpleName(),
201            target.toString(),
202            methodName,
203            printMethodArgsClasses(methodArgs));
204      LogUi.extended("Additional Info for the problem: {}", additionalInfo);
205   }
206
207   private static String printMethodArgsClasses(Object[] methodArgs) {
208      if (methodArgs == null || methodArgs.length == 0) {
209         return "";
210      }
211      return Arrays.stream(methodArgs)
212            .map(arg -> arg == null ? "null" : arg.getClass().getSimpleName())
213            .collect(Collectors.joining(","));
214   }
215
216   private static String truncateString(String input, int length) {
217      if (input == null) {
218         return PAGE_SOURCE_UNAVAILABLE;
219      }
220      return input.length() > length ? input.substring(0, length) + "..." : input;
221   }
222
223}
